chunks.title: Regulation 1 - Short title
chunks.text:
This regulation may be cited as the Duties Regulation 2023.
Commencement

chunks.title: Regulation 2 - Commencement
chunks.text:
This regulation commences on 2 September 2023.
Definitions

chunks.title: Regulation 3 - Definitions
chunks.text:
The dictionary in schedule 6 defines particular words used in this regulation.
Declared public unit trustâAct, s 79

chunks.title: Regulation 4 - Declared public unit trustâAct, s 79
chunks.text:
(1) For section 79 of the Act, each of the following unit trusts is
     declared to be a public unit trustâ
          (a) a unit trust mentioned in schedule 1, part 1;
          (b) a unit trust mentioned in schedule 1, part 2, if the
          conditions mentioned in subsection (2) are satisfied for
          the trust.
     (2) For subsection (1) (b), the conditions areâ
          (a) the trust is established and continues for the direct
          or indirect investment of funds of investors approved by
          the Treasurer; and
          (b) the trustâ
               (i) is not established or managed for a
               particular investor mentioned in paragraph (a);
               or
               (ii) if the trust is established or managed for a
               particular investor mentioned in paragraph (a)
               âhas been approved by the Treasurer as eligible
               to be declared as a public unit trust; and
          (c) the Queensland Investment Corporation, or a company
          wholly owned by the corporation, is the trustee for the
          trust.
     (3) However, the Treasurer may approve a trust under subsection (2)
     (b) (ii) only if the Treasurer is satisfied the investor for whom the
     trust is established or managed has a sufficient connection with the
     State.
Concessions and exemptions for transfer dutyâELN transfers and ELN lodgements

chunks.title: Regulation 5 - Concessions and exemptions for transfer dutyâELN transfers and ELN lodgements
chunks.main_structural_heading: Concessions and exemptions for transfer dutyâELN transfers and ELN lodgements
chunks.text:
(1) Each of the concessions for transfer duty mentioned in a
     provision of the Act stated in schedule 2, part 1 is a concession for
     transfer duty for an ELN transfer or ELN lodgement.
     (2) Each of the exemptions for transfer duty mentioned in a provision
     of an Act stated in schedule 2, part 2 is an exemption for transfer
     duty for an ELN lodgement.
Duty payable on travel insuranceâAct, s 349

chunks.title: Regulation 6 - Duty payable on travel insuranceâAct, s 349
chunks.main_structural_heading: Duty payable on travel insuranceâAct, s 349
chunks.text:
For section 349 (2) (a) (i) of the Act, duty is payable on 10% of the premium
received, for a travel policy mentioned in schedule 3, item 43(a), for travel
outbound from Australia, including baggage.
Apportionment of premiumsâAct, s 366

chunks.title: Regulation 7 - Apportionment of premiumsâAct, s 366
chunks.text:
(1) For section 366 of the Act, a premium for insurance is to be
     apportionedâ
          (a) for a class of insurance stated in schedule 3, column
          1âin the way stated opposite the class in column 2 of the
          schedule; and
          (b) for a bankerâs blanket policyâby apportioning each
          class of insurance covered by the policy in the way the
          class is apportioned under paragraph (a); and
          (c) for an umbrella excess of loss policyâin the way the
          predominating class of insurance covered by the policy is
          apportioned under paragraph (a).
     (2) In a provision in schedule 3, unless a contrary intention appears
     in the provision, a reference to a person or thing is a reference to
     the person or thing covered by the insurance.
     (3) In this sectionâ
     "predominating class of insurance" means the class of insurance that
     attracts the highest net premium.
Activities for prescribed business

chunks.title: Regulation 8 - Activities for prescribed business
chunks.text:
An activity, or a combination of any 2 or more activities, stated in schedule 4
is prescribed for schedule 6 of the Act, definition prescribed business.
Recognised stock exchange

chunks.title: Regulation 9 - Recognised stock exchange
Regulation 10 - Fees
chunks.text:
The fees payable under the Act are stated in schedule 5.
Rounding of amounts expressed as numbers of fee units

chunks.title: Regulation 11 - Rounding of amounts expressed as numbers of fee units
chunks.main_structural_heading: Rounding of amounts expressed as numbers of fee units
chunks.text:
(1) This section applies for working out the amount of a fee
     expressed in this regulation as a number of fee units.
     (2) For the purpose of the Acts Interpretation Act 1954, section 48C
     (3), the amount is to be rounded down to the nearest multiple of 5
     cents.
          Exampleâ
               Schedule 5, item 1(b) provides for a fee of 1.80
               fee units. If the value of a fee unit for this
               regulation were $1.025, the number of dollars
               obtained by multiplying $1.025 by 1.80 would be
               $1.845. After rounding down, the amount of the
               fee would be $1.80.

chunks.title: Schedule 6 - *** SCHEDULE 6 - Dictionary *** "exposure level" means the maximum possible monetary risk to the insurer if the insurer agrees to indemnify an insured person under an insurance contract. "federal interstate motor vehicle" means a motor vehicle registered under the repealed Interstate Road Transport Act 1985 (Cwlth). "high capacity regular public transport aircraft", for schedule 3, item 2(a), means an aircraft employed in regular public transport operations under the Civil Aviation Regulations 1988 (Cwlth), whose certificate of type approval under those regulations permits the aircraft to haveâ (a) a maximum seating capacity of more than 38 seats; or (b) a capacity to carry a maximum payload of more than 4,200kg. "limit of liability declared" means the maximum amount, mentioned in an insurance contract, payable to an insured person under the insurance contract. "predominant location", for a vessel mentioned in schedule 3, item 26(b), meansâ (a) if the insured person has disclosed to the insurer that the vessel will operate from its port of registration for the insurance yearâthe port of registration for that insurance year; or (b) if the insured person has disclosed to the insurer that the vessel will operate from more than 1 port during the insurance yearâthe port from which it will operate for most of that insurance year; or (c) if the insured person has disclosed to the insurer that the vessel will operate from more than 1 port during the insurance year but no port can be identified as the port from which the vessel will operate for most of the insurance yearâthe vesselâs port of registration for that insurance year. "Queensland Investment Corporation" means the Queensland Investment Corporation established under the Queensland Investment Corporation Act 1991.
